item.title: "Neither Cold Nor Hot" -- The Real Lesson of Lukewarm Laodicea
item.author: thecogcatholic@outlook.com (Darren)
item.description: When it comes to our religious faith, we all know itâ€™s better to be on fire than to be lukewarm. We ask the Holy Spirit to “enkindle in us the fire of your love.” If we cool off – if we don’t stay “hot” – we risk quenching the Spirit (1 Thessalonians 5:19). It would seem that if cold is the opposite of hot, then to be spiritually lukewarm is better than being spiritually cold.
